ygData.subject: Re: goodbye
ygData.msgSnippet: Don t worry, he s just jealous because he wasted all that time playing a boring necro, and missed out on the fun of being a druid. I know it s tough to admit
ygData.messageBody:
Don't worry, he's just jealous because he wasted
all that time playing a boring necro, and missed out
on the fun of being a druid. I know it's tough to
admit you're wrong, but just do it! Start your druid
char today and correct the errors of your past!! Want
a challenge?? Start a 1/2 elf druid. <br><br>You
know, playing around with all those undead all the time
can give you a sour disposition too. I've even seen
it from the pallys--who are generally good people,
if not a bit overzealous. <br><br>A little off
topic-- Necros are supposed to be really powerful, ok. I
RARELY see any on my server (xev), and have only grouped
with necros on a handful of occassions. (I group about
98% of the time-- i'm a social druid who's NOT a
kiting fanatic). Where are they all?? Are the out
soloing, defiling graves (haha Kroq), or hanging out with
the undead? I've always wanted to know this-- do the
ghouls, skellys, etc /con amiably to necros?? that would
be funny! <br><br>Tunare's children grow in her
light and bless Norrath, while those unworthy of her
glory wither and die in the shadows.<br><br>Xela
Orcbane<br>Druid of the 32d season<br>Defenders of Mithril
Hall<br>Xev
